alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:01AM EST until December 19 at 5:10AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Vermont... Mad River At Moretown affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mad River at Moretown. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, At 9 feet, the mad river begins to leave its banks. Field flooding occurs between Waitsfield and Moretown, and some local roads will flood. At 12.0 feet, At 12 feet, Route 100 will be covered with water in Moretown, and Route 100B will be partially covered. Water will inundate Telephone Flats near Waitsfield. At 13.5 feet, About 4 feet of water will cover Route 100 south of Moretown, nearly reaching a trailer park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Monday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 01/24/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
